hook.text: She took two weeks off and expected to feel better. Three months later she was still recovering. Burnout runs deep.

buildup.text: Mild burnout may recover in weeks. Severe burnout can take months to years depending on how long it built up.

discovery.text: Recovery isn't linear. Good days alternate with setbacks. The trajectory is upward but the path is jagged.

twist.text: Rushing recovery creates a second burnout. The pressure to heal fast recreates the same toxic pattern.

climax.text: Be patient with yourself. Recovery needs the same thing burnout denied you: time, rest, and self-compassion.

punchline.text: Recovery takes time. Be as patient as the burnout was long.

quiz.question: How long can severe burnout recovery take?
options: Months to years depending on severity
